questions.question_text: A/Question (PDF).
questions.solution: PDF solution.

questions.question_text: Match List-I with List-II: Process — Catalyst used. (A) Haber process (B) Wacker oxidation (C) Wilkinson catalyst (D) Ziegler catalyst. Catalysts: (I) Fe, (II) PdCl2, (III) [(PPh3)3RhCl], (IV) TiCl4 with Al(CH3)3. Correct match is:
questions.solution: Matching catalysts to processes as per PDF: Haber - Fe (I), Wacker - PdCl2 (II), Wilkinson - [(PPh3)3RhCl] (III), Ziegler - TiCl4 with Al(CH3)3 (IV). PDF picks option (2).

questions.question_text: Given statements: I. Ferromagnetism is considered an extreme form of paramagnetism. II. Number of unpaired electrons in Cr2+ (Z=24) is same as in Nd3+ (Z=60). Choose correct:
questions.solution: Ferromagnetism is an extreme form of paramagnetism (I true). Cr2+ has 4 unpaired electrons (3d4) while Nd3+ has 3 (4f3) so II false. PDF answer (4).

questions.question_text: If the half-life (t1/2) for a first order reaction is 1 minute, then the time required for 99.9% completion of the reaction is closest to:
questions.solution: For first order, time for 99.9% ≈ 10 × t1/2 ⇒ 10 minutes.

questions.question_text: The correct order of decreasing basic strength of the given amines is: (options in PDF)
questions.solution: Alkyl substitution enhances basicity; aniline derivatives reduced by resonance. PDF answer (4).

questions.question_text: A percentage-error propagation question in PDF: For P = a^3 b^2 / (c d) with % errors 1%, 3%, 2%, 4% in a,b,c,d respectively, the % error in P is:
questions.solution: PDF computes resultant percent error as 13% (see PDF algebra).

questions.question_text: The plates of a parallel plate capacitor are separated by d. Two slabs of K1 and K2 with thickness 3d/8 and 2d/8 are inserted. Capacitance doubles. If K1=1.25 K2, the value of K1 is:
questions.solution: Using series dielectric formula and Ceq = 2 C0 with given thickness ratios and K1 = 1.25 K2, algebra yields K1 ≈ 2.66 (PDF option 2).

questions.question_text: A ball of mass 0.5 kg is dropped from 40 m, hits ground and rises to 10 m. Impulse imparted during collision (g=9.8 m/s^2) is:
questions.solution: v1 = sqrt(2 g 40) = 28 m/s (down), v2 = sqrt(2 g 10) = 14 m/s (up). Impulse = m(v_final − v_initial) = 0.5*(14 − (-28)) = 21 N·s.

questions.question_text: Two cities X and Y connected by buses leaving every T minutes in either direction. A girl on scooter speed 60 km/h going X→Y sees a bus every 30 min in same direction and every 10 min opposite. Find T and bus speed:
questions.solution: Let bus speed v. From relative motion equations (v−60)·30 = v·T and (v+60)·10 = v·T, solving gives v = 120 km/h and T = 15 min.

questions.question_text: An oxygen cylinder of volume 30 L has 18.20 moles of oxygen. After some withdrawn, gauge pressure drops to 11 atm at 27°C. Mass of oxygen withdrawn is nearly:
questions.solution: Moles left n = (P V)/(R T) ≈ 14.54 mol ⇒ moles removed ≈ 18.20 − 14.54 = 3.656 mol ⇒ mass removed ≈ 3.656×32 ≈ 116.99 g ≈ 0.116 kg.

questions.question_text: Potential difference VA − VB at instant when i = 2 A and di/dt = +1 A/s is:
questions.solution: Using PDF circuit relations (including L di/dt etc.), VA − VB calculated as 10 V per PDF derivation.

questions.question_text: In an oscillating spring-mass system, a spring is connected to a box filled with sand which leaks slowly out vertically so that average frequency ω(t) and amplitude A(t) change with time. Which schematic depicts changes correctly?
questions.solution: As mass decreases due to leaking sand, ω increases and amplitude decreases; PDF selects option (3).

questions.question_text: Quantum model question from PDF regarding flux quantization: magnetic moment in lowest state n=1 is:
questions.solution: PDF derivation gives μ = (2 n h e)/(π m); for n=1 this is 2 h e /(π m) (option 3).

questions.question_text: A body weighs 48 N on earth. The gravitational force at height equal to one-third Earth's radius from surface is:
Capillarity / surface tension differential equation question: For liquid with surface tension S and density ρ, if y(x) is height, then which equation holds:
questions.solution: From curvature and Laplace pressure ΔP = S × curvature: ρ g y = S d^2y/dx^2 ⇒ ρ = (d^2 y/dx^2) g y / S (PDF option 3).

questions.question_text: Intensity of transmitted light when a polaroid sheet is placed between two crossed polaroids at 22.5° from axis of one polaroid (I0 intensity after first polaroid):
questions.solution: Using Malus' law and algebra with intermediate polaroid at 22.5° between crossed polaroids leads to final intensity I0/8 per PDF.

questions.question_text: A photon and an electron (mass m) have same energy E. The ratio (λ_photon/λ_electron) of their de Broglie wavelengths is:
questions.solution: λ_photon = hc/E; λ_electron = h/√(2 m E) ⇒ ratio simplifies; PDF lists option (4) 2 m c / E.

questions.question_text: Dalton's Atomic theory could not explain which of the following?
questions.solution: Dalton's theory could not explain gaseous volumes (Avogadro's law) — PDF answer (1).
questions.chapter: History of atomic theory / Gaseous laws

questions.question_text: Higher yield of NO in N2(g) + O2(g) ⇌ 2 NO(g) (ΔH = +180.7 kJ mol–1) can be obtained at:
options: Higher temperature; Higher concentration of N2; Higher concentration of O2
Higher temperature; Higher concentration of O2 only
Lower temperature; Higher concentration of N2 only
Lower temperature; Higher concentration of N2 and O2
questions.correct_answer: Higher temperature; Higher concentration of N2; Higher concentration of O2
questions.solution: Given reaction is endothermic; increasing temperature shifts equilibrium forward; increasing reactant concentrations shifts yield forward. PDF answer (1).

questions.question_text: Match List–I with List–II: A. XeO3, B. XeF2, C. XeOF4, D. XeF6 — (I) sp3d; linear, (II) sp3; pyramidal, (III) sp3d3; distorted octahedral, (IV) sp3d2; square pyramidal. Choose correct matching.
questions.solution: Taken from PDF matching (Answer (2)).

questions.question_text: Match List–I with List–II: A. Humidity, B. Alloys, C. Amalgams, D. Smoke — (I) Solid in solid, (II) Liquid in gas, (III) Solid in gas, (IV) Liquid in solid. Choose correct matching.
questions.solution: Humidity = liquid in gas, Alloys = solid in solid, Amalgam = liquid in solid, Smoke = solid in gas (Answer (3)).

questions.question_text: Energy and radius of first Bohr orbit of He+ and Li2+ (given RH = 2.18 × 10⁻¹⁸ J, a0 = 52.9 pm). Choose correct set.
questions.solution: Calculated using Bohr formulas; PDF answer (2).

questions.question_text: Which among the following electronic configurations belong to main group elements? A. [Ne]3s1 B. [Ar]3d34s2 C. [Kr]4d10 5s2 5p5 D. [Ar]3d10 4s1 E. [Rn]5f0 6d2 7s2. Choose correct options.
questions.solution: A (Na) and C (I) are main-group (s- and p-block); others are d- or f-block. PDF answer (3).

questions.question_text: C(s) + 2 H2(g) → CH4(g); ΔH = –74.8 kJ mol–1. Which of the following diagrams gives accurate representation of this exothermic reaction (enthalpy diagram)?
questions.solution: ΔH is negative so product lower in energy than reactants; PDF selects option (2).

questions.question_text: Predict the major product P for the given reaction sequence (organic reaction — see PDF).
questions.solution: Major product determined by reaction mechanism shown in PDF; answer (2).

questions.question_text: Identify the correct orders against the property mentioned: A. H2O > NH3 > CHCl3 – dipole moment, B. XeF4 > XeO3 > XeF2 – lone pairs on central atom, C. O–H > C–H > N–O – bond length, D. N2 > O2 > H2 – bond enthalpy. Choose correct combination.
questions.solution: PDF reasoning: statements A and D true; PDF answer (2).

questions.question_text: Total number of possible isomers (including stereoisomers) of cyclic ethers of molecular formula C4H8O is:
questions.solution: Enumeration of structural + stereoisomers yields total 10 (PDF answer (4)).

questions.question_text: For the reaction A(g) ⇌ 2B(g), the backward reaction rate constant is higher than the forward reaction rate constant by a factor of 2500 at 1000 K. (R = 0.0831 L atm mol–1 K–1). KP for the reaction at 1000 K is:
5 moles of liquid X and 10 moles of liquid Y make a solution with vapour pressure 70 torr. Vapour pressures of pure X and Y are 63 torr and 78 torr respectively. Which is true regarding the solution?
options: The solution has volume greater than sum of individual volumes
questions.solution: Raoult's law predicted 73 torr; observed 70 torr < 73 torr ⇒ negative deviation (PDF answer (3)).

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the unit of productivity of an ecosystem?
questions.solution: Productivity is rate of biomass production expressed as energy per area per time; PDF answer (1).

questions.question_text: The first menstruation is called:
questions.solution: Onset of menstruation at puberty is menarche (PDF answer (3)).

questions.question_text: Assertion (A): All vertebrates are chordates but all chordates are not vertebrates. Reason (R): Members of subphylum Vertebrata possess notochord during embryonic period; it is replaced by vertebral column in adults. Choose correct option.
options: A is false but R is true
Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is NOT correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
questions.correct_answer: Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation of A
questions.solution: Vertebrates are chordates; notochord replaced by vertebral column in adults — PDF answer (2).

questions.question_text: Genes R and Y follow independent assortment. If RRYY produce round yellow seeds and rryy produce wrinkled green seeds, what will be the phenotypic ratio of the F2 generation?
questions.solution: Dihybrid cross yields 9:3:3:1 phenotypic ratio (PDF answer (4)).

questions.question_text: Statement I: DNA fragments extracted from gel electrophoresis can be used in construction of recombinant DNA. Statement II: Smaller DNA fragments are observed near anode while larger fragments are found near the wells in agarose gel. Choose correct.
options: Statement I incorrect but Statement II correct
Statement I correct but Statement II incorrect
questions.solution: Fragments separated by size; smaller move farther; extracted bands used for cloning (PDF answer (2)).

questions.question_text: What is the main function of the spindle fibres during mitosis?
questions.solution: Spindle fibres attach to kinetochores and segregate chromosomes (PDF answer (2)).

questions.question_text: How many meiotic and mitotic divisions occur for development of a mature female gametophyte from the megaspore mother cell in an angiosperm?
questions.solution: Megaspore mother cell undergoes 1 meiosis producing 4 megaspores; functional megaspore undergoes 3 mitoses -> embryo sac (Answer (4)).

questions.question_text: Identify the statement that is NOT correct about antibodies: (1) Constant region of heavy & light chains are at C-terminus, (2) Each antibody has two light and two heavy chains, (3) Heavy and light chains are held together by disulfide bonds, (4) Antigen binding site is located at C-terminal region of antibody molecules.
options: Each antibody has two light and two heavy chains
Heavy and light chains are held by disulfide bonds
Antigen binding site is located at C-terminal region
questions.correct_answer: Antigen binding site is located at C-terminal region
questions.solution: Antigen binding site is at N-terminal region; so option (4) is incorrect (PDF answer (4)).

questions.question_text: Consider statements: A. Reductive division for human female gametogenesis starts earlier than male. B. Gap between first and second meiotic division is much shorter for males than females. C. First polar body is associated with formation of primary oocyte. D. LH surge leads to disintegration of endometrium and menstrual bleeding. Which are true?
questions.solution: A and B true; C and D false — PDF explanation (Answer (2)).

questions.question_text: Assertion (A): Cells of the tapetum possess dense cytoplasm and generally have more than one nucleus. Reason (R): Presence of more than one nucleus increases efficiency of nourishing developing microspore mother cells. Choose correct option.
options: A is false but R is true
Both A and R true and R is correct explanation
Both A and R true but R not correct explanation
A is true but R is false
questions.correct_answer: A is true but R is false
questions.solution: Tapetum cells are multinucleate and nourish microspores, but stated reasoning in R is not the correct interpretation as given in PDF (Answer (4)).
